item.title: Brazil sues Syngenta for alleged environmental damage
item.description:
Brazil's environmental agency IBAMA has sued Syngenta alleging the chemicals company caused "environmental damage" by producing and selling pesticides using much higher concentrations of a carcinogen than allowed under law, according to court documents seen by Reuters.

In the suit filed last week, IBAMA said it was seeking damages to remedy the environmental and human health problems arising from the use of such a toxic product.

IBAMA told a federal judge in Sao Paulo it had found evidence of use of a substance called "bronopol" at levels almost three times above the quantity authorized in the manufacturing of insecticide "Engeo Pleno."

That substance was also illegally added to insecticides "Karate Zeon 250 CS" and "Karate Zeon 50 CS" but is not a part of their formula, according to IBAMA's allegations.

Syngenta said it presented before the court "proof of the non-existence of any type of risk or environmental damage" resulting from the allegations made.

The Switzerland-headquartered firm said health agency ANVISA, the agriculture ministry and IBAMA itself recently approved a new version of "Engeo Pleno" which would be "based on the levels of bronopol found in the formulations mentioned in the suit."

The company did not comment on the other two products, but said it took multiple measures "to eliminate any possibility of failure of the nature detected by IBAMA during an inspection in 2021."

Syngenta would have produced 4.7 million liters of these three insecticides, of which at least 4.4 million were marketed, according to evidence produced by the agency and presented to the court.

IBAMA estimates that the sale of the allegedly adulterated products generated more than 400 million reais ($73 million) for the company.

The agency has also asked the judge to force the company, controlled by ChemChina since 2017, to identify, collect and properly dispose of products sold that have not yet been withdrawn from the market.

The courts have not made any decisions yet.

The value of the compensation will be determined during the course of proceedings, according to court documents.

To guarantee payment of damages in case IBAMA wins the case, the agency has asked the court to require the company to set aside 90 million reais.

($1 = 5.4849 reais)

item.title: 独家：企业考虑在死刑威胁后将台湾员工从中国移出
item.description:
Some foreign companies are considering relocating Taiwanese employees out of China after Beijing said it could impose the death penalty on "diehard" Taiwan independence separatists, according to four individuals familiar with the matter. The new guidelines have prompted some Taiwanese expatriates and foreign multinationals operating in the country to reassess their legal risks and exposure, said the people, who include a lawyer and two executives with firsthand knowledge of the discussions. "Several companies have come to us to assess the risks to their personnel," said James Zimmerman, a Beijing-based partner at Perkins Coie law firm. He declined to disclose the companies or industries due to confidentiality reasons. "The companies are still worried about potential grey areas, such as whether a benign social media post or voting for a specific political party or candidate in Taiwan elections could be interpreted as pro-independence activities." Reuters previously consulted Perkins Coie on unrelated matters in China. As of 2022, around 177,000 Taiwanese were working in China, according to the most recent Taiwan government survey. Taiwanese staff are employed by many multinationals in China due to their language skills and cultural familiarity with the country. Employees at Chinese operations of Taiwanese firms have been estimated to have invested over $200 billion since 1991, contributing to China's growth as the world's second-largest economy.

Chinese corporations operating in the country have held safety meetings with employees on this issue, said two executives who asked not to be named due to the sensitive nature of the matter. One source said some Taiwanese staff in China have accepted the option to leave the country. China views Taiwan as its own territory, with democratically governed Taiwan rejecting Beijing's claims of sovereignty, stating that only Taiwanese people can decide their future. Taiwan's president, Lai Ching-te, has condemned China's new guidelines. The June 21 guidelines criminalize promoting Taiwan's entry into international organizations with statehood requirements, external official exchanges, and the suppression of parties, groups, and people supporting "reunification." Other acts seeking to separate Taiwan from China are also illegal, allowing Beijing to interpret the rules broadly, according to legal experts. Among "the masterminds or those who have committed serious crimes", if the harm to the country and people is particularly serious and circumstances are particularly bad, they may face the death penalty. The regulations do not specify who might be subject to the death penalty further.

When asked to comment on how companies and Taiwanese employees are responding to the guidelines, China's foreign ministry said in a statement: "Using criminal law measures to punish criminal separatist elements and uphold national interests is a common practice for all countries. It should be emphasized that the relevant legislative document targets the extreme minority of diehard 'Taiwan independence' elements and their separatist activities, and it only affects a small part of Taiwan compatriots." China's Taiwan Affairs Office did not respond to a request for comment. Last week, it said that most Taiwanese have nothing to worry about and can visit "in high spirits." The Mainland Affairs Council, which oversees relations with Beijing, informed Reuters in a statement: "The government reminds Taiwanese businesspeople and employees in mainland China to pay more attention to their personal safety. The risk is indeed increasing.'

As a result of the new regulations, the council last week advised Taiwanese citizens to avoid unnecessary travel to China, Hong Kong, and Macau. It also noted that eight retired Taiwanese military and police officers had been detained in China over the previous year, and academics were being detained and interrogated when they entered China on formal exchange programs, even if they were on such programs.

One of the executives who spoke to Reuters, a senior official who works with Taiwan investors in China, said his phone lit up after China announced the new guidelines as people discussed the implications for their work. Chinese leaders criticize Taiwan's Lai as a "separatist" and staged war games shortly after his May inauguration. Taiwan has complained of increased Chinese pressure since Lai's January election win, including ongoing military activities, trade sanctions, and coast guard patrols around Taiwan-controlled islands near China.

Lai repeatedly offered talks with China but was rejected.

item.title: 佩吉拉在温布尔登被王参与美国队打倒，独立日 woes
item.description:
周四，在美国独立日，杰西卡·佩古拉在美国温布尔登网球比赛中，在五号种子的身份下，在第二轮中败给了中国的王欣雨，比赛成绩为：6-4 6-7(9) 6-1。

中国的参赛者轰出了38记制胜球，加上佩古拉的33个非受迫性失误，最终赢得了比赛并获得与哈里特·达特的第三轮对决的机会。哈里特·达特在一场紧张的三局对决中击败了英国选手凯蒂·鲍尔特，王的行为让世界排名42的她在比赛中获胜，这是她首度战胜top 10 的选手。

对于佩古拉，这次的失败是一股屋顶降落在她头上的打击，此前她有着出色的表现进入了草地大满贯比赛。在柏林的预热赛事中，她在决赛中挽救了五个赛点，赢得了她职业生涯的首个草地冠军，击败了安娜·卡拉尼采娅，并希望这一次能够比去年的四分之一决赛有更出色的表现。

尽管佩古拉的挑战以失败收场，但是她的同国同胞却在其他地方传来了好消息。随后在第三号法庭上登台的11号种子达琳娜·科林斯避免了任何失误，这可能是她最后一次在温布尔登参加比赛，这是因为退役即将来临。

她在与匈牙利的资格赛选手达尔马·加尔菲的比赛中以6-3 6-4获胜，准备面对巴西选手贝亚蒂莎·哈达德·梅亚的第三轮对决。男子第14号种子本·谢尔顿也进入了第三轮，他与南非的资格赛选手洛德·哈里斯的对决持续了近四个小时。谢尔顿在决胜盘中以10-7的比数赢得了最后一场纳斯尔比赛，并将在周六面对加拿大选手德尼斯·沙波瓦洛夫。

item.title: <p>中国在联合国会议中拒绝了西方国家对人权改革的关键呼吁。</p>
item.description:
China on Thursday rejected Western-led recommendations for human-rights reforms including calls for greater freedoms in Hong Kong and for Uyghurs in Xinjiang, but accepted others from allies, as it sought to defend its record at a U.N. meeting.

The U.N. Human Rights Council session in Geneva caps off a review process in which Beijing has strived to fend off criticism following a 2022 U.N. report which said the detention of Uyghurs and other Muslims in China's Xinjiang region may constitute crimes against humanity. China denies any abuses.

The council's president, Omar Zniber, said China had accepted nearly 70% of the more than 400 reform recommendations it received as part of the U.N. review.

"Progress and development on human rights is achieved in China with each passing day," China's ambassador, Chen Xu, told the meeting, alongside a large delegation of Chinese diplomats and officials. He said it rejected recommendations that were "politically motivated based on disinformation, ideologically biased or interfering in China's traditional sovereignty" and condemned what he called an attempt to "smear and attack" it.

Yet China's critics say its high acceptance rate is misleading, with one Western diplomat alleging the country had "stacked the deck" by investing political capital in quelling criticism.

Reuters previously reported that China had lobbied non-Western countries to praise its record by asking them to make "constructive recommendations."

British ambassador Simon Manley complained to the council that China had rejected each and every one of its recommendations, including a call for an end to persecutions of Uyghurs and for the Hong Kong security law to be repealed.

U.S. Human Rights Ambassador Michèle Taylor also voiced disappointment at what she called China's refusal to take action.

"China's abuses constitute a rejection of U.N. assessments and recommendations and violate or undermine international commitments," she said. Other countries were more upbeat, including Russia's envoy who praised China's "constructive approach" and Gambia's envoy who lauded the country's progress.

The U.N. review of China is not unique and all countries undergo the process every few years at the council - the only intergovernmental body designed to protect human rights worldwide.

An attempt to hold a debate about the U.N. High Commissioner's China report was voted down by mostly non-Western members later in 2022 - a result seen as a diplomatic victory for Beijing.

item.title: China warns of hotter, longer heatwaves as climate change intensifies
item.description:
China is facing hotter and longer heatwaves and more frequent and unpredictable heavy rain as a result of climate change, the weather bureau warned on Thursday, as the world's second-biggest economy braces for another scorching summer.

In its annual climate "Blue Book", the China Meteorological Administration (CMA) warned that maximum temperatures across the country could rise by 1.7-2.8 degrees Celsius within 30 years, with eastern China and the northwestern region of Xinjiang set to suffer the most.

Last year, average national temperatures hit a new high, leading to record levels of glacial retreat and melting permafrost in the northwest, the Blue Book said.

China describes itself as one of the world's most climate-vulnerable countries, and it is coming under increasing pressure to adapt to rapidly changing weather patterns and sea levels that are rising faster than the global average.

"China is a region that is sensitive to global climate change, a region where the impact will be significant," said Yuan Jiashuang, vice-director of the CMA's National Climate Centre, at a briefing.

She warned that if emissions remained high, extreme heat events expected to occur once every fifty years in China could happen every other year by the end of the century, and rainfall could double and become more unpredictable.

The weather bureau said on Thursday that it expects temperatures in most areas across China to be relatively high over the next few months, signaling a second consecutive summer of extreme heat.

"The weather is going to be different from previous years and there is more extreme weather now," said Chen Yuhan, a resident of China's commercial hub Shanghai, which saw above-38 Celsius (100.4 Fahrenheit) temperatures on Thursday.

"It surprises me every time I go out."

Torrential rains and floods are already battering the south, and temperatures have broken records in several parts of north and central China, threatening crops and putting pressure on electricity grids.

Average temperatures from March to May hit their highest since records began in 1961, according to official data.

Record-breaking temperatures last month broiled key grain-producing provinces in the northwest and east, forcing corn farmers to delay planting, while torrential rain in other regions flooded soybean and rice fields.

"It is necessary to guard against the risk of yield reduction of cotton, early rice, and late rice caused by high temperature and heat damage," Jia Xiaolong, CMA's deputy director, said at the briefing.

Summer temperatures in regions including Zhejiang, Jiangxi, Hunan, Fujian, Guangdong, Guangxi, Gansu, and Ningxia are expected to be 1 to 2 degrees Celsius above normal, CMA said.

The weather bureau also said that two typhoons could make landfall in mainland China in July. The typhoons are expected to move in a westward or northwestward direction, authorities said.

Last year, two powerful typhoons – Doksuri and Haikui - made landfall, causing massive rains that broke records in some areas, unleashed flooding and prompted widespread evacuations.

item.title: 中国比亚迪在泰国开设电动车工厂，东南亚首座
item.description:
中国比亚迪（002594.SZ）在周四（未指明具体日期，原文为“Thursday”）在泰国开设了一座电动汽车工厂，这是该制造商在东南亚的首家工厂，东南亚是一个正在快速发展的电动汽车市场，比亚迪在这里成为了主导玩家。

比亚迪首席执行官兼总裁王传福在开幕仪式上说：“泰国有着明确的电动汽车愿景，并正处于汽车制造行业的新时代。我们将把中国的技术带到泰国。”

比亚迪的工厂是来自中国电动汽车制造商在泰国投资的浪潮的一部分，估计总投资超过14.4亿美元，这些公司正在泰国建立工厂，得益于政府的补贴和税收激励。

在周四的跳涨之后，香港上市的比亚迪股份价格攀升了1.6%，达到每股港币235元，创下一周内的最高水平。

泰国是一个区域汽车组装和出口中心，长期以来主要由日本汽车制造商如丰田汽车（7203.T）、本田汽车（7267.T）和五十铃（7202.T）主导。

至2030年，该国计划将其每年生产量为250万辆汽车中30%转化为电动汽车，根据政府的计划。

“比亚迪正在使用泰国作为出口至东盟及其他许多国家的生产枢纽，”泰国投资委员会秘书长纳里特•索斯拉巴斯说，指的是这个拥有10个成员国的东南亚联盟。

作为其中国以外扩张的一部分，比亚迪正在建立其在匈牙利的首个欧洲生产基地。该工厂预计将在三年后运营，将生产面向欧洲市场的电动汽车和插电式混合动力车。欧盟正在对进口自中国的电动汽车征收最高近38%的关税，而中国的电动汽车关税约为17%。

两年后投入运营、价值4.9亿美元的泰国产比亚迪工厂年产能为15万辆，包括插电式混合动力车。

在该工厂生产的右舵电动汽车可能有助于比亚迪绕过适用于中国制造车辆的欧盟关税。比亚迪亚太区总经理刘学良说：“我们还将在这里组装电池和其他重要部件。”

泰国是比亚迪最大的海外市场，今年一季度其在该国电动汽车细分市场的市场份额达到46%，在乘用车领域排名第三，根据研究公司Counterpoint的数据。其他在泰国市场的电动汽车竞争对手包括长城汽车（601633.SS），该公司也在泰国设有生产设施，以及美国汽车制造商特斯拉（TSLA.O）。

item.title: Bpifrance 看好投资 Sanofi 的消费者健康业务
item.description:
Bpifrance 代总经理 Jose Gonzalo 表示，法国的公营投资银行正在考虑对赛诺菲的<a href="https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/SASY.PA" target="_blank">(SASY.PA)</a>消费保健部门进行潜在的投资，据彭博社周四报道。

Gonzalo 被引用表示，该法国公营投资银行正在与“许多基金”交涉，并可能与胜出者合作，一同投资赛诺菲的消费保健部门。

Bpifrance 确认 Gonzalo 在周四的简报会上作出了关于赛诺菲消费保健部门和其他潜在投资的评论。

赛诺菲在一封电子邮件中表示，不评论市场传言，并补充说法国制药商正在为可能的消费保健业务分离做准备，同时保留所有选项。

Gonzalo 告诉彭博社称 Bpifrance 还在研究对旅游和旅行公司Club Med 的投资，这个说法也被 BpiFrance 确认。

Club Med 尚未立即对要求提出评论的请求作出回应。

彭博社的报道称，专注于私募股权的 CVC 资本合伙人与 Bpifrance 在 6 月曾商谈联合购买来自中国复星的 Club Med 的少数股权的问题。

彭博社的报道还表示，由于法国议会选举，用于销售仿制药制造商 Biogaran 的售出已经停摆，尽管 Bpifrance 与 BC Partners 已经提交了非约束性报价。

商业报纸 La Lettre 报道称，法国总理 Épiphane Attal 在 5 月表示，法国政府告诉制药公司 Servier 反对出售 Biogaran，该公司的法国市场份额接近三分之二。

item.title: <p>欧盟公布了其针对中国电动汽车关税计算的详情.</p>
item.description:
欧洲委员会在七月份宣布了为期九个月对中国电动车市场的调查结果，提供了该委员会如何计算关税和为什么支持对中国最高调的贸易诉讼的主要证据。报告揭示了中国政府和国家企业上汽集团（600104.SS）对配合欧洲委员会对中国电动车生产商可能获得不公平国家支持的调查感到犹豫。
这份报告详细描述了上汽集团单独面临高额关税率37.6%的情况，而其他中国电动车生产商比亚迪（002594.SZ）和吉利（GEELY.UL）分别面临较低的关税率17.4%和19.9%，这反映出它们配合调查的程度。
七月份周五开始实施的对中国制造电动车的暂时性关税最高可达37.6%，这加剧了与北京之间的紧张关系，后者威胁报复。此案很可能会作为欧洲委员会辩护的一部分，如果中国政府向世界贸易组织投诉的话。报告提到，中国政府对它的电动车制造商的严格控制手段阻止它们像追求利润的最大化理性市场的经营者一样运作，实际上迫使它们履行政府的角色。
报告得出结论，欧洲制造商面临的“实际伤害威胁”是明显存在的并即将发生的。该报告的内容也像四月份公布的一个更详细的版本那样，涵盖了欧盟委员会上次咨询文件中所说的问题，指出中国政府对该国经济和战略产业的介入可能成为未来贸易战基础内容的一部分。据报道，flowers会采取更为强硬的立场来对付北京。
欧盟委员会发现，中国政府向中国电动车生产商提供的补贴形式包括优惠贷款、廉价土地和卖电动车的直接激励。这些生产商在电池成本，也就是电动车最贵的部分，也得到了帮助。在提供电池的公司中，上汽集团和吉利能以低于公允价值得到电池，虽然比亚迪自己生产电池，但它有一流的电池组件，尤其是锂。
报告中最有见地的部分是一份关于政府对各公司补贴内容的公司分类拆解，所有这些补贴加在一起构成各个公司应该缴税率的基础。以上汽集团为例，欧盟估计其补贴总额为34.4%。这组成分为：1.38%来自国家拥有的银行的贷款，8.27%是其他形式的融资，8.56%是以拨款的形式，2.28%是鼓励销售电动车的激励，0.67%是廉价土地，13.24%是过低价格的电池。
比亚迪在相同类别的补贴总计为15.1%，吉利为19.72%。中国政府部门曾抱怨欧盟在补贴调查时索要信息量空前，要求详细阐述中国电动车生产商的供应链情况。但报告中详实记录了在包括在中国注册电动车的数量、品牌、型号和地点等方面的一些领域中，北京部门要么拒绝合作，要么未能提供迄今为止更基本的信息。
报告说：“高度不可能中国政府在特定时间段内不掌握中国注册电动汽车的数目信息。”
报告还阐述了上汽集团逃避提供所需信息的情况，该集团表示无法提供。
报告说，向上海汽车集团、比亚迪和吉利提供贷款的中国金融机构并未提供信用状况评估，因此欧盟委员会进行了自己的调查。三家汽车制造商都得到了中国国有企业信用评级机构授予的最高AAA级信用评级。从评级更高的机构获得的评级意味着更低的利率。但由于存在高债务与权益比率和使用贷款还款的问题，欧盟委员会发现这三家公司的总体财务评级相当于B级。根据投资者的标准，B级债券被视为垃圾债。
报告：中国金融机构向上海汽车集团、比亚迪和吉利提供的信贷并没有提供信用评估，因此欧盟委员会自行进行了调查。尽管这三家汽车制造商都获得了由中国国有企业评级机构授予的顶级AAA级信用评级，并因此享受更高的评级和更低的利率。然而，实际上，由于面临的问题领域，如较高的负债权益比率和用借贷还债的使用方式，欧盟委员会发现他们的总体财务评级对应于较低的B级。投资者将B级债券视为垃圾债券。

item.title: 欧盟对中国制造的电动汽车的反应
item.description:
欧盟将自周五起对从中国进口的电动汽车征收最高达37.6%的暂定关税，这是迄今为止欧盟最大的贸易案件，加剧了与北京的紧张关系。

以下是对此消息的一些反应：

“显然，我们现在正在与成员国进行咨询，也包括在那些暂定关税实施之前，成员国也对保护它们的汽车工业免受不公平竞争感兴趣。

“我们的目的是...确保公平的竞争和一个公平的竞技场。因此，我们再次认为，我们看不到任何报复的依据。

“与中国的这些会谈正在进行中，诚然，在双方便利的解决方案出现的情况下，我们也可以找到方法最终不实施关税。

“但很明显，这种解决方案需要解决我们当前面临的市场扭曲问题，并符合市场要求。”

“清楚的是，欧盟希望找到解决方案...（计划征收的）关税（的措施）是为了纠正不平等和不公平的竞争格局，损害欧盟电动汽车生产者，与在中国生产车辆的生产商相比较而言。”

“我们欢迎欧盟委员会与中国正在进行的谈判。...德国政府认为一个和解的解决方式是国际贸易关系中非常可欲和正确的方式，以避免升级的威胁，最终伤害所有人的利益。应该充分利用法律空间找到解决方案。”

“德国政府也很清楚，我们需要中国作出实质性和进展。...我们不希望对我们国家的公司关闭市场，相反，我们也不希望这些外国公司关闭我们的市场。

“这就是为什么德国政府一开始就致力于确保在反补贴调查中考虑到所有相关方面，并谨慎地平衡它们，这也是为什么我们也呼吁中国解决产能过剩和非法补贴问题的原因。”

欧洲最大的汽车制造商大众公司（VOWG_p.DE）

“欧盟委员会决定的时机对当前德国和欧洲对电动汽车的需求造成了不利影响。

“由于这个决定的负面影响超过了对欧盟和特别对德国汽车工业的任何好处，它不构成对我国汽车工业的助益。大众集团自信地面对来自中国在内的国际日益激烈的竞争，并视之为机遇-这也有利于我们的客户。”

“中国和欧盟委员会必须尽一切努力通过开放和建设性的对话找到解决方案。不能让全球贸易战成为现实。

“中国的角色在可以成功转型到电动化和数字化的过程中起着决定性的作用 ，贸易战也会危及这一转型。

“我们需要的是一个促进我们工业国家的长处，发展具有国际竞争力的位置，开拓新市场，集中创新，从而确保我们的繁荣和增长的方法。”

中国电动汽车制造商蔚来（9866.HK）

“目前阶段，蔚来汽车在欧洲市场保持其车型的价格。然而，关税的实施可能会导致价格的调整。

“尽管如此，蔚来坚定地致力于欧洲市场，我们相信通过培养竞争和消费者兴趣来获得接受和青睐，我们希望在正式措施实施前11月之前就与欧盟达成解决方案。”

中国电动汽车制造商小鹏（9868.HK）

“所有当前等待交货和未来在关税生效前下订单的顾客都将受到任何价格上涨的保护。

“我们致力于积极保持市场竞争力，并尽量减少对当前和未来客户的影响。

“目前我们不会改变我们在意大利车型的价格”。

“临时反倾销关税不是谈判的矛盾，通常情况下，在商品政策工具的应用中与谈判伴随的是常见和建设性实践。”

“现在重要的是利用秋季永久关税实施前的窗口机会，对北京进行密集会谈...German Industrie-Verband（德国工业联合会）呼吁欧盟委员会和成员国在外界面前展现团结。

保时捷（P911_p.DE）

“保时捷公司代表自由的世界贸易和对话。商品的自由流通必须继续。

“征收惩罚性关税损害了一个像德国那样出口的国家。为了使欧洲尽可能具有韧性，并在日益激烈的国际竞争中保持成功，最重要的是：国际上具有竞争力的地理位置条件。”

item.title: 中国建造的电动汽车在其遭遇的欧盟最大贸易案件中被征收关税。
item.description:
从周五起，欧盟将对中国制造的电动汽车征收高达37.6%的关税，欧盟官员表示，这加剧了布鲁塞尔迄今为止最大的贸易案件中与北京的紧张关系。

然而，这些关税的征收为期四个月，是初步的，并且双方预计会进行继续深入的会谈，因为北京威胁要采取广泛的报复行动。

欧洲委员会征收的在不追溯计算的情况下介于17.4%和37.6%之间的初步关税旨在防止欧洲委员会主席乌尔苏拉·冯德莱恩所说的可能的大规模便宜电动汽车涌入，这些电动汽车是用国家补贴建造的。

这些税率公布在周四发布的长达208页的文件中，与6月12日委员会宣布的税率几乎相同。执行部门在公司指出了最初的披露中存在轻微的计算错误后进行了调整。

北京当时表示它将采取“一切必要措施”来保护中国的利益。

这可能包括对向中国出口的产品，如 cognac 或 pork，如对中国的报复性关税。

欧盟贸易专员瓦尔迪斯·东布罗夫斯基斯表示，中国没有回应的基础。

“我们的目标是...确保公平竞争和一个平等的竞技场，”他在接受彭博社采访时说。

欧盟的反补贴调查还将在五个月后运行。

在最后审理期结束后，欧盟执行委员会，欧盟的执行部门，可能会提议为期五年的最终关税，欧盟成员国将对此投票。

“与中国的这些会谈正在继续进行，而且确实应该在一个互利的解决方案出现时，我们也可以找到在最终不再征收关税的方法，”东布罗夫斯基斯说。

“但它非常清楚这个解决办法（需要）解决我们目前存在的市场失当，而且必须符合市场规则。”

中国商务部周四表示，双方已经就关税问题进行了几轮技术会谈。

“我们希望欧洲和中国方面朝着同一个方向前进，展示诚意，并尽快推进会商过程，”商务部发言人何亚东说。

比亚迪对符合17.4%的关税，吉利为19.9%，上汽集团为37.6%，欧盟周四表示。这在欧盟对汽车进口的标准10%关税之上。

欧盟被认定为合作进行反补贴调查的公司，包括西门子特斯拉（TSLA.O）和BMW（BMWG.DE）将面临20.8%的关税，那些没有合作的公司则面临37.6%的税率。

中国汽车制造商面临着吸收关税或提高价格以覆盖在欧洲边境产生的数十亿美元新成本的选择。

"中国的汽车制造商渴望将销售扩展到中国以外，因为国内价格战正在造成损害，”咨询公司Sino Auto Insights的创始人Tu Le说。

欧盟电动汽车成本的增加将削弱欧盟到2050年成为碳中立国家的目标，反对者表示。

(002594.SZ)理想汽车和蔚来汽车、特斯拉、BMW、法国干邑威士忌制造商等相关受影响企业，指责称中国在欧盟电动汽车关税政策为欧洲消费者带来更高的电动汽车成本。

然而，中国电动汽车制造商可能不得不考虑增加成本，以维持在欧洲市场的竞争力。增加关税可能会促使中国汽车制造商在欧洲投资工厂，尽管欧洲的劳动力和制造成本比中国高。

周四，小鹏汽车成为最新一家考虑在该地区建立制造工厂以避免关税的电动汽车制造商。

item.title: Puppy love: Canine weddings on the rise in China
item.description:
这是一个梦幻般的婚礼，配以宜人的户外环境，白色蕾丝长裙和一块令人垂涎的蛋糕。金毛寻回犬——布瑞和邦德——在最亲近的人类和狗狗朋友们面前，成为了金毛犬界完美的结婚礼仪。

在中国，宠物婚礼的数量正在上升，尽管政府在鼓励民众在这个人口老龄化、人口持续下降、结婚率和出生率仍然偏低的社会里步入婚姻的政策并未取得成功。

宠物的流行和人们在它们身上的过度消费使得这种趋势更加显著。2023年，宠物消费增长了3.2%，达到了人民币2793亿元（约384.1亿美元），根据行业数据显示。

「人们会有婚礼，为什么狗狗就不能有呢？」布瑞的主人瑞羚笑着说，指的是他刚刚为他的女友下了走道的布瑞举行了婚礼。在这个仪式上，布瑞和邦德一起交换了誓言，保证彼此分享零食，一起玩耍。

据研究公司Acuity Knowledge Partners的数据显示，2023年底，中国的城市中已经有超过1.16亿只猫和狗。如果平均分布于中国城市人口，大约每八位中国居民当中，就有1位拥有猫或狗，其中大部分主人年纪在40岁以下。

瑞羚和他的女朋友欣琪，说自己并不急于结婚，但精心策划了数月的这场犬类仪式。他们安排了专业的摄影师，设计了婚礼手册，订制了一个包含邦德和布瑞的仿制品的婚礼蛋糕，蛋糕价格为800元。

这位来自上海的宠物烘焙店老板杨涛，最初对此现象感到惊奇，但她表示，越来越多的业主想要为他们的宠物举行婚礼。

「我认为宠物婚礼会越来越多，」杨涛说，「自从2022年我的烘焙店开业以来，我已经筹备了几个这样的仪式。」而且，她已经接到了几个月后的订制婚礼蛋糕订单，那是针对宠物婚礼的订单。

瑞羚希望这场仪式能给布瑞和邦德一种仪式感，并且他并没有表示自己想要生孩子，但他希望不久的将来能够迎来几只小狗。

（1美元 = 7.2712人民币）

item.title: Stocks stretch record run, pound pauses as UK votes
item.description:
World stocks clocked up more record highs on Thursday after U.S. data narrowed the odds on a September Fed interest rate cut, while Europe was on politics watch again as UK voters headed to the polls in national elections.

The July 4 holiday in the United States made for thin trading, amplified as investors sat on their hands to see just how large a majority the Labour Party might get when the UK's election exit poll and results start coming out around 2100 GMT.

Markets are well prepared for a change given opinion polls have for months put the centre-left party on course for a landslide victory over the Conservatives, who have held power for 14 years through both Brexit and the COVID-19 pandemic.

"Having been very negative of sterling for a very long time, institutional investors are actually going into this election quite neutral," said Michael Metcalfe, head of macro strategy at State Street Global Markets.

That is partly, he said, because political risk has surged in the likes of France, which holds the second round of its parliamentary elections in three days' time, and in the United States ahead of its Presidential vote in November.

"The UK, oddly, has ended up with a neutral position in the middle," Metcalfe said. "Also, I don't think at any point has the result (of the election) been in any doubt."

UK polling stations opened at 0600 GMT and by lunchtime London's FTSE 100 early 0.6% rise had extended to almost 1%, while sterling had crept up to $1.2760 and 84.6 pence per euro leaving it up almost 4% and 2.2% on the respective currencies since April. /FRX

Additional tailwinds for the FTSE came from MSCI's main global index (.MIWD00000PUS), which notched up its latest record high after Wall Street's S&P 500 and Nasdaq had done the same ahead of the July 4 celebrations.

Across the English Channel from Britain, polls in France suggested National Rally (RN) would not win a majority of seats in Sunday's second round of Parliamentary election as mainstream parties moved to block the far right.

France's bond yields, which move inversely to price and are a proxy for government borrowing costs, still edged higher though as the country's treasury sold 10.5 billion euros ($11.3 billion) worth of bonds into the market, although it was a welcome sign that it all went smoothly.

French bond "spreads have been tightening and sentiment has been a bit more positive," said Jussi Hiljanen, head of rates strategy at lender SEB.

A hung parliament appears the most likely result in the French elections, as left and centrist groups strike deals to try to keep Marine Le Pen's National Rally from power.

Car shares were on the move again as the European Union said it plans to impose tariffs of between 17.4% and 37.6% on Chinese electric vehicle makers like BYD (002594.SZ), Geely (GEELY.UL) and SAIC.

There is however a four-month window during which talks are expected to continue with Beijing, which has unsurprisingly threatened to retaliate.

The bulls were still charged up though after chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA.O) started Wall Street's July 4 celebrations early by adding another 4.5% to what is now a near 160% leap in it shares this year.

Asia (.MIAP00000PUS) then closed up nearly 1% overnight to reach its highest since April 2022, as Japan's Nikkei (.N225) finished within spitting distance of its March peak and Taiwan's main index (.TWII) also struck a record as Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) (2330.TW) cleared T$1,000 for the first time.

The U.S. ISM measure of services activity surprised by sliding to its lowest since mid-2020, with employment notably weak ahead of the June payrolls report due on Friday.

Analysts cautioned the series was contradicted by strength in the PMI survey of services, but did note that price measures in both surveys pointed to easing inflation.

A run of subdued data mean Citi's U.S. economic surprise index has sunk to -47.5, the lowest since August 2022. Meanwhile, the closely watched Atlanta Fed's GDPNow estimate fell to just 1.5% from 1.7%.

That should be music to the ears of the Federal Reserve, with minutes of its last meeting showing committee members wanted more evidence of a cooling economy before cutting rates.

At the time of that meeting, the GDPNow growth estimate was running around 3% annualised.

"Reading through the minutes from only three weeks ago, it is a good reminder of how quickly the activity outlook has deteriorated," said Paul Ashworth, chief North America economist at Capital Economics.

"Given the more encouraging personal consumption expenditure data in May, the risk of a reacceleration in inflation seems even less likely, particularly with GDP growth now running well below its potential," he added. "We still think that the Fed will begin to cut interest rates this September."

Markets quickly lifted the probability of a September rate cut to 74%, from 65%, while pricing in 47 basis points of easing for this year.

With the U.S. economy now seemingly less exceptional, the dollar dropped across the board. The euro was up at $1.0797 , and away from its recent low of $1.0666, while the dollar index hit its lowest in three weeks.

The Australian dollar was a notable gainer, touching a six-month peak of $0.6733 at one point with markets wagering the next move in local rates could be higher.

The yen remained out in the cold, hitting multi-year lows on a host of currencies as investors continued to favour carry trades. The dollar stood at 161.11 yen after striking a 38-year top of 161.96 on Wednesday.

The drop in the dollar was a boon for commodities, with gold rallying to $2,358 an ounce , from $2,318 at the start of the week.

Oil prices eased a touch, having gained the previous day when a surprisingly large decline in U.S. crude stocks pointed to firmer demand as the U.S. driving season gets underway.

Brent dipped 43 cents to $86.93 a barrel, while U.S. crude fell 54 cents to $83.03 per barrel.

item.title: 菲律宾总统下令在南中国海降低紧张局势，军事负责人表示。
item.description:
菲律宾总统费迪南德·马科斯 Jr.命令其武装部队缓解南海地区的紧张局势，其军事负责人于周四表示，在中国对重新补给争议礁岛上的菲律宾部队的任务提出异议后。马科斯的指示是在马尼拉和北京在周二由马尼拉主办的一轮会谈中同意需要恢复信任和信心以更好地管理海上争端之后发出的。

但菲律宾军队仍然要求中国归还海岸警卫队从菲律宾海军人员那里夺取的手枪，并为损坏在上个月重新补给任务中涉及的船只支付大约100万美元的赔偿。

"我要求归还七把手枪，"罗慕洛·布兰沃尔将军在接受与马科斯的指挥会议后对记者说。“我们要求中国赔偿6000万菲律宾比索他们造成的破坏。

马尼拉指责中国海岸警卫队故意撞击和故意刺破海军船只，并夺取武器，以破坏上个月在第二托马斯礁石的重新补给任务，严重伤害了一名菲律宾水手，他失去了一个手指。菲律宾维持一个由少量人员控制的锈迹斑斑的战舰，自1999年以来在第二托马斯礁岩上搁浅，以加强其海上索求权。

布兰沃尔说，军队正在考虑将成本直接计入被伤害水手的指尖修治好。

中国声称对南海大部分地区拥有领土主权，尽管中国坚称其在航道的合法性和专业性，该航道是亚洲、欧洲和中东之间贸易的关键通道。

中国外交部发言人毛宁在简报中表示："菲律宾应该对自己的侵权行为承担后果。"她还说，菲律宾方面"非法运送补给品"，是首先挑起事端。

北京拒绝了设在海牙的常设仲裁法院2016年的判决，称其广泛的海洋索求权没有法律依据。

菲律宾的军队向马科斯总统展示了在南海执行任务的几种选择，但这不会导致补给操作实质性的改变，布兰沃尔说，他没有具体说明。

"最终目标仍然是能够向我们部队运送补给，"他说“能够进行自由航行和航越，而无需进一步激化你所处的情况。

在同样的简报中，布兰沃尔说，菲律宾的武装部队还将与参议员协调，她声称收到了有关中国计划使用其超音速导弹袭击其国家的消息。自称对事件有了解的参议员伊梅·马科斯，总统的姐姐并是参议院外交关系委员会主席，在本周的一段发布在TikTok上的视频中引起了震动，她声称这些导弹正在开发中，但并没有提供证据。

中国外交部表示，他们不知道这些指控源自何处，但坚持北京遵循防御性的国防政策，并不构成对任何国家的威胁。

"当然，我们绝不会袖手旁观，任由自己的合法权益和区域和平与稳定被侵犯和威胁，"毛宁说。

北京曾批评4月和5月菲律宾境内的美国中程导弹系统的部署，当时正在进行联合军事演习。一名军队发言人证实，台风导弹发射器仍部署在菲律宾北部岛屿上，但他没有具体说明这枚导弹何时会被“运走”的确切日期。

马尼拉寻求在海上声索权问题上获得更广泛的国际支持，寻求与各国建立更密切的关系，以倡导基于规则的秩序，确立国际法。

布兰沃尔表示希望在7月8日举行的防长和外长会议期间签署菲律宾和日本军方互访协议。

(这个故事已被修正，指出导弹何时被“运走”没有具体的日期，在第18段。

item.title: <p>日本与菲律宾的国防合作协议谈判已接近尾声，大使表示.</p>
item.description:
Negotiations between Japan and the Philippines for a Reciprocal Access Agreement on defence and security are close to conclusion, Tokyo's ambassador to Manila said on Thursday.

The role of the Philippines in maintaining regional stability and security was undoubtedly important, ambassador Kazuya Endo said in a speech.

A significant development can be expected on defence equipment transfer, he said.

Japanese and Philippine foreign and defence ministers will meet in Manila on July 8 for talks that could include a breakthrough defence pact that would allow their military forces to visit each other's soil.

The Philippines has been ramping up its ties with neighbours and other countries to counter what it describes as China's growing aggression in the South China Sea.

Maintaining peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait is critical for the Indo Pacific region, Endo said.

item.title: Carmakers respond to EU tariffs on Chinese-made EVs
item.description:
With the European Union imposing extra duties on Chinese-made electric vehicles from Friday, some carmakers have decided on counter measures.

So far only Tesla (TSLA.O) has announced plans to increase prices, while Chinese brands MG and NIO (9866.HK) suggested they might raise prices of their cars in Europe later this year.

Analysts expect other manufacturers producing in China will also pass on part of the extra cost to consumers.

Below is a list of the carmakers' response to the tariffs:

BYD (002594.SZ)

The Chinese carmaker, which faces the lowest tariff hike of 17.4% on top of the current 10% duty, has not decided yet whether to hike prices on EVs sold in the European Union, sources close to the company told Reuters.

There would be no decision before July 4, when provisional duties take effect, sources added.

The Chinese automaker said its planned EV production in Spain, set up through a joint venture with Spain's EV Motors, should help offset tariffs on imports into the EU.

Production at the Barcelona-based site is expected to start by the end of the year, Charlie Zhang, vice president of Chery Auto, said.

The site is not big enough for the carmaker's medium- and long-term plans in Europe, Zhang added, saying the company was looking for a possible second site.

A spokesman for MG, produced by China's SAIC Motor (600104.SS), told Reuters in France that the automaker had enough vehicles in stock "to last until November without increasing prices", referring in particular to the MG4 model.

MG's country manager for Italy, Andrea Bartolomeo, told Reuters that for the moment the brand was not planning any price action on its car line-up in the country.

The EU has imposed a tariff of 37.6% on EVs produced by SAIC.

NIO (9866.HK)

The Chinese automaker said it may adjust the price of its cars in Europe as a result of the preliminary tariffs. It added it hoped to reach a resolution with the EU before the measures become definite in November.

NIO is facing a tariff of 20.8% on its EVs.

item.title: 习近平和普京提出了欧亚安全俱乐部的雄心
item.description:
中国国家主席习近平和俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京在周四的峰会上，代表欧亚大陆大型地区的国家，呼吁加强安全、政治和经济合作，以此作为抗衡西方联盟的手段。

他们在哈萨克首都阿斯塔纳举行的上海合作组织（SCO）峰会的第二天发表讲话。该组织由俄罗斯、中国和中亚国家在2001年发起，现已包括印度、伊朗和巴基斯坦。

“SCO成员国应该加强团结，并共同反对外部干涉，面对干涉和分裂的真实挑战，”新华社引述习近平的话说，并警告西方的“冷战心态”。

普京在SCO的演讲中重申了俄罗斯关于“建立一个合作新架构，在欧亚大陆实现不可分割的安全和发展”的呼吁，以取代过时的欧陆中心主义和北约模式，这些模式给予某些国家单方面的优势。

他再次将乌克兰战争归咎于西方，并表示如果基辅及其支持者接受莫斯科的会谈条件，俄罗斯准备冻结冲突。

普京上个月表示，提议的新欧亚安全条约应该向该地区的所有国家开放，包括当前的北约成员国。但他表示，目标应该是逐步消除欧亚大陆的外部军事存在，这显然是对美国的明确提及。

SCO成员国代表了新的俄罗斯如石油、天然气等商品的主要买家，因为针对乌克兰战争的西方制裁迫使莫斯科转向亚洲。

普京周四还赞扬了SCO国家之间使用本币（而非美元）进行贸易的增加，并呼吁集团内部创建一个新的支付系统。

西方制裁将莫斯科隔绝于传统的支付系统如SWIFT，同时数十亿美元的俄罗斯海外储备仍然被冻结。

“多极化世界已成为现实，”普京说：“越来越多的国家支持公平的世界秩序，并准备积极地捍卫自己的合法权利和传统价值观。

另外，印度外交部长苏布拉马尼亚姆·贾亚尚卡尔在SCO集会期间与中国的外交部长王毅会面，并同意加强讨论，解决自2020年武装冲突以来与边界相关的问题，以缓和双边关系。

item.title: 弱的中国需求打击印度钻石出口，行业寻求支持
item.description:
印度的切割和抛光钻石出口因来自关键市场中国的需求疲软而受挫，除非政府为该行业提供支持，否则不太可能稳定下来，一位主要贸易团体的负责人周四表示。

印度是世界上最大的切割和抛光钻石中心，占全球近十分之九的切割后钻石。

“我们正在与需求疲软作斗争，尤其是在中国受到COVID-19缓慢复苏的影响之后。因此，需求持续下降。”吉美和珠宝出口促进委员会（GJEPC）主席Vipul Shah接受路透社采访时表示。

中国约占印度切割和抛光钻石出口的三分之一，并主要通过香港购买。

经济下滑、消费者从钻石转向购买黄金珠宝的偏好转变，以及婚礼减少等因素，正在挤压中国对钻石的需求。

根据Vipul Shah的说明，印度的切割和抛光钻石出口在截至今年3月31日的2023/24年度下降了27.5%，上一季度（6月季度）下降了近15%，与去年同期相比。

行业陷入了困境，上个月它请求政府在本年度预算中提供一些让步，以便能够度过目前的困难时期，他说道。

GJEPC呼吁政府允许在特别通知区（SNZs）销售原钻石，并允许如Bonas和I Hennig等得到全球认可的钻石贸易商从SNZ运营，Shah表示。

与比利时和迪拜不同，印度竞标者无法从SNZ购买原钻石，原因是没有税收减免。

由于对抛光钻石的需求疲软以及导致宝石和抛光钻石价格软化带来的利润率压力，印度宝石单位已削减了原钻石进口。

印度珠宝行业雇佣了超过430万人，占印度商品出口的10%以上。

item.title: <blockquote> <p>华为高管拒绝了先进芯片短缺将阻碍中国人工智能雄心这一想法.</p> </blockquote>
item.description:
Chinese technology giant Huawei's (HWT.UL) senior executive, Zhang Ping'an, CEO of Huawei Cloud, on Thursday refuted the notion that a scarcity of the most sophisticated artificial intelligence chips would impede China's aspiration to lead in AI. Zhang asserted that innovation is crucial to address the issue, stating, "Nobody will deny that we are confronting limited computing power in China... But we cannot lean solely on having AI chips with the most advanced manufacturing process nodes as the ultimate pillar for AI infrastructure."

Zhang's remarks came in the midst of stricter US limitations on advanced AI chip imports to China, including a ban on sales by firms like the US powerhouse Nvidia (NVDA.O).

"If the absence of the most advanced AI chips is regarded as an obstruction to leading in AI, then we must discard this perspective," Zhang maintained.

Huawei, which was placed on the US Entity List, preventing its acquisition of advanced chips from US firms, has developed its own AI chip product named Ascend, which is now utilized by numerous Chinese companies for training AI models.

However, the Ascend AI chip, alongside other products from Chinese companies, is considered significantly less powerful in terms of computing power compared to Nvidia's offerings.

Referring to the cloud, Zhang solicited innovative methodologies to offset the lack of advanced AI chips through novel computing architecture innovations. He advocated for a unified approach to integrate cloud, edge, and networks to reduce energy costs and boost efficiency overall. Zhang highlighted Huawei Cloud as a leader in sourcing such innovative solutions.

item.title: MG, Nio提示今年汽车价格将上涨，这是在欧盟电动汽车关税决定之后。
item.description:
中国品牌MG和Nio (9866.HK) 周四表示，他们可能在今年晚些时候提高欧洲市场的汽车价格，紧随欧盟确认对从中国进口的电动车征收关税的决定。

中国汽车制造商Nio 在一份声明中表示，它可能调整其在欧洲的汽车价格，以应对欧盟的关税决定。

法国MG汽车公司的发言人告诉路透社，MG汽车有足够的库存可以持续到11月，无需提高价格，特别是MG4型号。

item.title: 欧盟对中国补贴和进口进行调查
item.description:
欧盟将于7月5日起对从中国进口的电动汽车征收最高达37.6%的关税，这一措施加剧了与北京的贸易紧张，是欧盟旨在保护本土制造商最新努力的一部分。

此外，欧盟还启动了对中国清洁能源生产者是否在欧盟市场上倾销补贴商品以及中国所有公司的子公司是否在欧盟经营时不公平地从补贴中获益的调查。

执行这些调查的欧盟委员会表示，其目标是防止不公平竞争和市场扭曲。

以下是有关调查您需要知道的内容：

欧盟委员会于6月12日宣布，将对由于中国政府给予的补贴超过其所说的“合理水平”而从中国进口的电动汽车征收新的关税。

临时关税将于7月5日生效，反补贴调查将一直持续到11月2日，届时有可能应用为期通常为五年的最终关税。

比亚迪（002594.SZ）将面临17.4%的关税，吉利（0175.HK）面19.9%的关税，上汽集团则面临37.6%的关税。这些关税是在欧盟原有的10%汽车进口关税基础上上叠加的。

欧盟认为与调查合作的公司，包括特斯拉（TSLA.O）和宝马（BMWG.DE）等西方汽车制造商，将适用20.8%的关税，而未与调查合作的公司的关税率为37.6%。

欧盟在5月16日启动了针对钢铁板或涂层铁或钢平板的反倾销调查，涉及中国锡。

欧盟官方公告指出，这一调查是应欧洲钢铁协会Eurofer的投诉。

调查在14个月内结束，可能在7到8个月时实施初步关税措施。

欧盟在5月16日启动了针对于异向地板进口的调查，依据是欧洲复合木地板联合会的投诉。

调查对象包括组装的多层实木地板面板，竹制或至少表面为竹制的产品以及马赛克地板面板除外。

欧盟委员会于4月24日启动针对中国医疗设备市场向欧盟的调查，这是欧盟“国际采购器械”法案的首次实施，其旨在防止国家未能公平对待国外供应商。

如果发现西方供应商无法公平进入中国市场，欧盟可以对在中国医院招标的中国医疗器械企业施加限制。

调查将在9个月内完成，但欧盟委员会有可能延长此期限达到14个月。

欧盟目前正在调查即将进入欧洲的中国风力涡轮机供应商所获得的补贴，欧盟竞争事务专员Margrethe Vestager在4月9日表示，该调查认为这些补贴歧视性地将中国公司置于不利地位。

调查对象包括在西班牙、希腊、法国、罗马尼亚和保加利亚的风电场开发，Vestager未点名这些公司。

中国表示该调查具有歧视性，并支持贸易保护主义。

欧洲委员会宣布因中国投标者从投标过程中撤回而结案关于位于罗马尼亚的太阳能电站的一次公开招标，欧盟工业委员Thierry Breton在5月13日宣布这一情况。欧盟在4月3日启动了两起针对外国补贴在太阳能领域对企业影响的调查。

第一起调查针对包括罗马尼亚ENEVO集团的一家子公司和中国LONGi绿色能源技术公司 lesser/601012.SS 的联合体。第二起涉及中国国有公司上海电气集团 lesser/601727.SS 的子公司。

布伦特表示特斯拉太阳能和上海电力建立都在投标过程中撤回，因此这一调查将会结束。

item.title: <p>印度和中国的外交部长同意合作解决边界问题。</p>
item.description:
印度外长苏拉梅南·贾瓦德卡尔周四在哈萨克斯坦与他的中国同行王毅会面，双方同意加快会谈以解决边境问题，新德里在一份声明中表示。

印度与中国共享绵长喜马拉雅山脉边界，边界大部边界界限不清。两国关系自从2020年7月军事对峙事件以来一直紧张，那事件导致至少20名印度士兵和4名中国军队人员死亡。

印度声明，贾瓦德卡尔在阿斯塔纳举行的上海合作组织峰会上与王毅会面期间，同意“当前边界地区的情况延续对双方都没有益处”。

双方同意加快外交和军事高级官员会议，“尽快解决剩余问题”，印度外交部声明称。

一位中国外交部声明引用王毅称，双方应该妥善处理分歧，确保关系稳定发展。

“我们必须保持积极态度，一方面妥善处理和控制边界地区的局势，另一方面积极恢复正常交流。”王毅表示。

印度总理莫迪，上个月开始他的第三个任期，今年4月说，两国应紧急解决边境的“长期冲突”。自2020年以来，两国在边界部署加固防线，增派部队和装备，这些核武装国家是数十年的不安邻国，1962年爆发了一场血腥的边界战争。

“他（贾瓦德卡尔）重申遵守两国政府过去达成的相关双边协定、协议和理解的重要性，”新德里的声明称。

两国之前曾同意通过军事和外交渠道保持对话。

item.title: <p>欧盟对中国电动汽车的调查接下来会发生什么？</p>
item.description:
EU regulators will impose provisional duties on Chinese-made electric vehicles (EVs) imported into the European Union from Friday, without backdating, they said, risking retaliation from Beijing.

The European Commission, which oversees EU trade policy, announced duties of between 17.4% and 37.6%, almost the same as those disclosed in June. The executive made adjustments after companies identified minor calculation errors in the initial disclosure.

These are on top of the EU's standard 10% tariff for car imports.

Provisional duties can be imposed for a maximum of nine months after the start of an EU anti-subsidy investigation if the Commission concludes it needs to prevent injury to EU industry.

They can be applied for up to four months, by which point the Commission will decide whether to apply final duties, known as definitive duties. In the EV case, the deadline for this is Nov. 2.

Provisional duties are only collected if definitive duties are imposed at the end of the investigation. If definitive duties are lower or not applied, then provisional duties are adjusted down accordingly. Until then, customs authorities normally just require a bank guarantee from importers.

The European Commission has held technical talks with Chinese officials and said that any negotiated outcome must effectively address the injurious subsidies.

After the announcement of provisional duties in the EU official journal, detailing the ongoing investigation and its findings, interested parties such as China and EV producers have until July 18 to comment. They can also request a hearing.

The Commission already visited more than 100 sites of automakers in China and Europe and done the bulk of its investigation.

Its final report generally reads as a confirmation of its provisional findings, with possible adjustments following comments received.

Definitive duties are often a little lower than the provisional rates, reflecting an acceptance of some of these arguments.

One new element will be Tesla's (TSLA.O) request the Commission calculate a separate duty rate for it.

The largest EV exporter from China to Europe will want to have a lower rate than the 20.8% for companies that have cooperated with the investigation, a group it is in.

As an alternative to duties, exporters can commit to selling their products at or above a minimum price. Chinese exporters agreed such an undertaking in the case of solar panels a decade ago. However, cars are not commodities, so it is hard to see how a minimum price could be applied.

At the provisional stage, the Commission has full power to impose duties, although it consults EU members and is supposed to take their positions into account. They are to submit their positions by July 15.

EU members wavering over whether to back additional tariffs on Chinese-built electric vehicles, highlighting Brussels' challenge in building support for its largest trade case yet as Beijing threatens wide-ranging retaliation.

At the end of the investigation, the Commission can propose definitive duties, normally applying for five years.

Its proposal could be blocked if a qualified majority of the European Union's 27 个成员 is opposed. A qualified majority means 15 EU members representing 65% of the EU population. In most cases, there is no blocking majority.

Any company not in the sample group of BYD (002594.SZ), Geely (GEELY.UL) and SAIC (600104.SS) that wishes to have its own individual duty can ask for an "accelerated review" just after the imposition of definitive measures. Such a review should last a maximum of nine months.

The Commission can also carry out an "interim review" after 1 年之前 has elapsed if the measures are no longer necessary or if they are not sufficient to counteract subsidies.

The Commission itself often looks into whether producers are evading duties via exports of parts for assembly elsewhere. For the EU, such circumvention exists if 60% or more of the value of parts are imported from the country subject to duties and if the value added in the assembly is no more than 25%.

Companies can challenge the measures at the European Court of Justice. China can take the European Union to the World Trade Organization. Both legal paths can take well 1 年之前.

item.title: 台湾认为中国大陆扣押渔船可能是一种心理战行为。
item.description:
中国扣押在靠近中国海岸的台湾渔船的举动可能是北京设计的心理战，旨在进一步对台北施压，台湾正在努力争取释放船只，官员们周四表示。

中国的官员在周二晚些时候上船并拿走了这艘船，将其带到中国的港口。这艘船在中国水域捕鱼，靠近由台湾控制的金门岛。中国表示，这艘船违反了夏季禁止捕鱼的规定，并进行了非法捕鱼。

这一事件发生在台湾海峡紧张局势加剧的时期。中国视民主治理的台湾为其领土，并自5月赖清德就任总统以来加强了对台北的压力，北京指责他为“分离主义者”。

大陆事务委员会部长邱คณะ Chin-cheng 在台北对记者说，政府将尽最大努力争取放回船只和渔夫，并通过台湾的半官方海峡交流基金会与中国进行沟通。

另外，邱也呼吁北京展现善意，停止对台湾的压力。

台湾国家安全局局长陈明义当天早些时候在国会向记者说，中国官员上船并拘留台湾渔船的做法颇为罕见，并指出对方解释该船非法捕鱼。但他也指出，中国此举可能是为了展示其对海峡的管辖权，并对台湾政府施加压力。

“我们必须继续分析这是否是认知战行动，并全面评估中共动机，”陈明义说。

中国以前曾因非法捕鱼而扣押过台湾的渔船，但缴纳罚款后便可释放，台湾海岸警卫队表示。

周三晚些时候，中国台湾事务办公室表示，扣押船只是出于保护渔业资源和环境的“正常执法”，考虑到其非法渔业行为。

“有关部门将依法处理此事，”声明中称。

据说船上有三名印尼籍渔民，根据台湾的海岸警卫队。

中国声称对海峡具有主权。台湾和美国都说它是国际水域。

台湾连续四年抱怨中国“灰色地带”行动的加剧，这些行动在不引发全面冲突的情况下试图削弱台湾，包括在台湾上空发射“气球”。

item.title: China和欧盟就即将出台的电动汽车关税进行了技术谈判。
item.description:
China and欧洲在对从中国进口的电动车征收关税的问题上进行了多轮的技术谈判，欧洲委员会预计将于周四确认这一措施。商务部在例行新闻发布会上表示：“迄今为止，中欧双方已经进行了多次技术层面的磋商。”

“在仲裁前还有四个月的时间，我们希望欧中双方能够朝着同一个方向前进，展现出诚意，并尽快推进磋商进程。”这位商务部发言人补充道。

欧洲委员会预计将在对中国制造的电动车征收临时进口关税，最高可达37.6%，欧盟之前指责世界上第二大经济体为中国企业提供了巨额的国家补贴。

欧盟的贸易政策越来越倾向于保护主义，原因是担心中国的以生产为导向的发展模式可能会让欧洲市场充斥廉价商品。随着中国企业在国内需求疲软的背景下试图加大出口，这种担忧愈发严重。

北京否认指控，称中国的电动车并未受到不公平的补贴。

“一些欧盟成员国政府和一些主要汽车公司曾多次公开反对欧盟的反补贴措施。”这位发言人说，“我们希望欧盟能够倾听欧盟内部的声音，以理性务实的方式与中国进行沟通，避免采取反制措施损害中欧汽车行业的互利合作与共同发展。”

欧盟国家在是否支持对中国制造的电动汽车征收额外关税的问题上出现分歧，这凸显了布鲁塞尔建立对其最大贸易案件的共识的挑战，而北京则威胁将采取广泛的报复行动。这个问题将在未来几周举行的投票中由欧盟27国进行审议。

德国的汽车制造商去年有三分之一的销售来自中国，据报道，德国希望停止征收这些关税。法国则一直在为其坚定的支持而努力。

中国正在进行关于进口欧洲白兰地的反倾销调查。据中国海关数据显示，去年几乎所有来自欧盟的白兰地出口均来自法国。

中国还对欧洲进口的猪肉及副产品展开了反倾销调查，分析人士认为此举旨在向西班牙、荷兰和丹麦施压，以迫使它们在限制措施的问题上与欧盟委员会背道而驰。

item.title: 亚洲股市吸引强劲的海外流入资金，关注美国利率前景及科技股上涨
item.description:
外国投资者在经历了两个月的抛售后，于六月将大量资金注入亚洲股市。美国通货膨胀压力的缓解使得人们希望美国联邦储备会在年内降息。

全球人工智能相关企业的增长，进一步提振了市场乐观情绪，使得亚洲技术及半导体产品出口需求提高。

根据韩国、印度、台湾、印度尼西亚、越南、泰国和菲律宾的证券交易所数据显示，外国投资者净买入亚洲地区股市价值约为71.6亿美元。

美国通胀稳定于5月，商贸部公布的报告与经济学界预测相符。美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔在周二表示美国已回到“通缩路径”，这一说法增强了人们对降息即将来临的期待。

拥有强大技术出口力的韩国和台湾，在过去一个月的股市中分别吸引了383亿和194亿美元的外国购买。

盈亚证券策略师易俊荣表示：“两国都成为了AI投资热潮的主要受益者。”

得益于全球科技复苏的浪潮，MSCI亚洲太平洋信息技术指数（.dMIAP0IT00PUS）在六月上涨了近10%，这是其七个月来的最佳表现。

印度市场吸引了31.9亿美元的外资，这一数额与上个月的30.6亿美元净抛售形成鲜明对比。

投资专家贝宝资产管理的林明岳表示：“随着选举后的短暂恐慌性抛售后，印度股市很快反弹至上涨趋势。投资者对新政府的政策连续性持有信心。”

“我们相信，印度经济正站在一个多年的经济周期的转折点，这一周期受到‘生产关联激励计划'(PLI)项目、有利的人口结构以及大量外国直接投资（FDI）的推动。”

然而，泰国、越南、菲律宾和印度尼西亚的股市各自面临约9.36亿美元、6.58亿美元、1.04亿美元和9100万美元的净流出。

贝宝资产管理的林明岳指出：“我们对于亚洲股市的前景保持乐观态度。”

“绝大多数地区的央行加息周期似乎已经接近转折点，这将对亚洲股市产生积极影响。”

item.title: Tesla cars for first time on Chinese government purchase list
item.description:
Tesla's (TSLA.O)最畅销的车型Model Y被中国某地方政府列入可以购买作为公务用车的电动车及插电式混动车型名单，据中国官方媒体《纸》报道。

这是特斯拉车辆首次在中国政府购置名单中获得资格。

江苏省政府在6月6日的官方声明中公布了56批新能源汽车采购，这些车辆将用于政党和公共组织的公务用车。除了在特斯拉上海工厂生产的Model Y和沃尔沃XC40，其余54批次均为国产电动车和混动车。沃尔沃汽车隶属于中国企业浙江吉利控股集团。

中国媒体和政府没有详细说明江苏省政府可以购买多少辆Model Y。

特斯拉的车辆在中国一些政府和军事机构之间的准入被禁止。

在4月特斯拉车队在中国的数据收集符合要求后，这些限制被取消。

随着中国车辆海外需求受到关税前景和国内竞争加剧的影响，特斯拉中国制造车辆的交付量在2023年上半年比同一时期减少了9%。

然而，特斯拉CEO埃隆·马斯克在4月底访问中国并与总理李强会面，看样子收到了正面的效果。

中国政府对特斯拉的支援增加，后者计划在中国建立一个 数据训练中心并推出全自动驾驶软件，尽管与美国在科技领域的紧张关系持续。

item.title: 德国停止了原计划将大众的燃气轮机业务出售给中国。
item.description:
德国内阁在周三阻止了大众汽车集团(Volkswagen)旗下公司MAN Energy Solutions的燃气轮机业务向中国公司出售的计划，部长们援引了安全理由。

此决定出台之际，欧洲联盟(European Union)与中国的贸易紧张局势正在升级。德国经济部可以审查并阻止被认为对国家安全构成影响的交易，柏林和欧盟正试图降低与北京方面经济关系带来的风险。

该德国业务在2023年6月以未公开价格卖给中国国资企业中国船舶集团所属的中国船舶工业长沙GH燃气轮机有限公司(GHGT)，但这笔交易在9月时被政府叫停作进一步审视。

GHGT属于中国船舶集团，这家公司控制着中国的造船行业。

一些德国政界人士担心，中国可能会将这些燃气轮机用于军事用途，而不只是为了民用。

在新闻发布会上被问及此决定时，内政部长南希·法斯勒(Nancy Faeser)表示，出于安全的原因，她欢迎该决定。

中国外交部在周四的例行新闻发布会上表示反对在正常的商务合作中进行政治化以及设立“人为障碍”。发言人毛宁说：

“我们应该在互利共赢的原则下，基于共同利益和市场规则，加强经济和贸易合作。”

她补充说，中国希望德国为包括中国企业在内的所有企业提供公正、公平、无歧视的商业环境。

经济部长罗伯特·哈贝克(Robert Habeck)表示，德国通常欢迎投资，但如果涉及到“公共秩序”的技术，就必须得到保护，这就是交易被叫停的原因。

MAN能源解决方案公司表示尊重政府的决定，并将开始一个有组织的过程来裁减燃气轮机的开发。

“我们将尽一切可能小心地执行这一阶段，考虑到员工、客户和合作伙伴的利益，”该公司在一封电子邮件声明中表示。该业务大约有1.4万员工。

周二，一位来源告诉路透社，该集团将保留其盈利的涡轮机服务业务。

德国政府呼吁企业减少对中国这个其最重要的贸易伙伴的依赖，并推动为公司建立公平的竞争环境。

欧盟也在采取行动阻止其认为电车行业中的不公平中国补贴，尽管德国的汽车工业联合会对欧盟委员会希望对来自中国制造的汽车征收关税的计划提出了反对。

item.title: <p>中国的习近平呼吁地区安全组织抵制“外部干涉”.</p>
item.description:
中国国家主席习近平在由俄罗斯和其最新成员白俄罗斯包括在内的一个地区性的经济、国防和安全联盟的会议上表示，成员国必须共同行动，抵抗“外部干涉”，并坚定支持各自国家。

“面对小院高墙的真实风险，我们必须捍卫发展的权利，”据中国国家电视台CCTV报道，习近平在2024年7月3日哈萨克斯坦阿斯塔纳举行的上海合作组织（SCO）理事会成员国首脑会议第24次会议上说。

他补充说，这个10成员国的联盟必须以和平方式处理“内部分歧”，寻求共识，并解决合作难题。

习近平还强调了共同促进科技创新的必要性，并保持工业和供应链稳定顺畅的重要性。

从2001年在上海成立起，SCO从一个有六个成员国的区域性组织扩展为一个拥有10个完全成员的跨区域联盟，包括在本周四正式加入的白俄罗斯。

该联盟的其他成员包括印度、伊朗和哈萨克斯坦。

item.title: 中国警告长时间的热浪可能损害稻米和棉花作物
item.description:
中国气象局在7月警告称，今年中国东部、中部和南部地区可能出现持续的热浪，这对于大米和棉花的生产可能造成影响，极端天气持续威胁中国粮食生产。

中国气象局表示，在未来几个月内，中国大多数地区的气温将会相对较高，预示着连续第二年出现高温。

“需要警惕由高温和热损害引起的棉花、早稻和晚稻产量减少的风险。”中国气象局副局长贾晓龙在简报会上说。

包括浙江、江西、湖南、福建、广东、广西、甘肃和宁夏等地区的夏季温度预计将比正常情况高1到2摄氏度（1.8到3.6华氏度）。

由于气候变化，中国面临着越来越长时间且更热的热浪以及更多样的极端降雨，这是中国气象局的警告所指的事实。

上个月打破记录的高温已经烤焦了中国西北和东部的主要粮食生产省份，迫使玉米农民推迟播种，而其他地区的暴雨则淹没了许多大豆和稻田。

全球范围内正在经历极端天气的农作物因为气候变化的影响加剧了伤害，中国的广袤农田、俄罗斯、印度及美国的许多农田都遭受了极端高温和低于正常降雨的打击，这不仅挤压了全球的粮食供应，也推高了价格。

在年度气候“蓝皮书”中，中国气象局警告称，未来30年，全国最高气温将升高1.7到2.8摄氏度（3到5华氏度），东部中国和新疆的西北地区将受到最大影响。

该气象局还表示，7月份可能有两场台风登陆中国大陆。负责机构表示，台风预计将向西或西北方向移动。
